article.headline: Albany, N.Y. 66, Stony Brook 61
article.story: ALBANY, N.Y. (AP) -- Jon Iati scored 20 points and Jason Siggers added 15 to lead Albany to a 66-61 win over Stony Brook on Monday night. Albany improved to 11-7 overall with the win, and 4-2 in the America East. Stony Brook fell to 6-11 overall and 1-4 in conference play. The Great Danes went on a 14-5 run to open the second half in building a 38-28 lead. Jimmie Covington scored seven of his 11 points in that burst. The Seawolves closed the gap to 38-34 when Solomon Bamiro, who had 12 points for the game, converted a fastbreak layup and Mitchell Beauford, who had 15 points, sank two foul shots. But Albany responded with 14 of the game's next 18 points. Jamar Wilson, who had eight points of the game, had six consecutive free throws to ignite the run. Stony Brook fought back over the next seven minutes behind the play of Ricky Lucas, who had 13 of his 17 points after halftime. Lucas sank two free throws to slice the deficit to four, including 61-57, with 1:49 remaining. Stony Brook shot 37.9 percent from the field for the game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
